page.title: 02KIRKBY UNDERWOOD VILLAGE
page.content:
The village of Kirkby Underwood has few amenities save the Norman church which stands a few hundred yards to the west of the community surrouded by open fields, and still used for regular Sunday services albeit there is no longer a resident incumbent, and a village hall housed in the former village primary school.
The traditional village green is no more than a small triangle of grass, recently re-kerbed, holding a basic signpost at the junction of the roads to Stainfield, Rippingale and Bulby.
In the main street will be found the village post box outside the former Post Office with a telephone kiosk and bus shelter nearby. .... continued
